es.uam.eps.ir.ranksys.fast.feature

Class SimpleFastFeatureData<I,F,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.uam.eps.ir.ranksys.fast.feature.AbstractFastFeatureData<I,F,V>
      • es.uam.eps.ir.ranksys.fast.feature.SimpleFastFeatureData<I,F,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - type of the items
    F - type of the features
    V - type of the information about item-feature pairs
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    FeatureData<I,F,V>, FeatureIndex<F>, ItemIndex<I>, FastFeatureData<I,F,V>, FastFeatureIndex<F>, FastItemIndex<I>

    public class SimpleFastFeatureData<I,F,V>
extends AbstractFastFeatureData<I,F,V>
    Simple implementation of FastFeatureData backed by nested lists.
    Author:
    Sa√∫l Vargas (saul.vargas@uam.es)

      • load

        public static <I,F,V> SimpleFastFeatureData<I,F,V> load(String path,
                                                        Parser<I> iParser,
                                                        Parser<F> fParser,
                                                        Parser<V> vParser,
                                                        FastItemIndex<I> iIndex,
                                                        FastFeatureIndex<F> fIndex)
                                                 throws IOException
        Load feature data from a file. Each line is a different item-feature pair, with tab-separated fields indicating item, feature and other information.
        Type Parameters:
        I - type of the items
        F - type of the features
        V - type of the information about item-feature pairs
        Parameters:
        path - file path
        iParser - item type parser
        fParser - feature type parser
        vParser - information type parser
        iIndex - item index
        fIndex - feature index
        Returns:
        a simple map-based FeatureData
        Throws:
        IOException - when path does not exist or IO error

        Load feature data from a input stream. Each line is a different item-feature pair, with tab-separated fields indicating item, feature and other information.

        V - type of the information about item-feature pairs

        fParser - feature type parser
        vParser - information type parser
